meanings.definition: A device that makes a buzzing sound
meanings.sent1: The buzzers in the classroom signaled the end of the test.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the buzzers of the alarm system going off in the building.
meanings.sent3: The buzzers in the game show were so loud that they made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The buzzers of the doorbell sounded like angry bees waiting outside.
meanings.sent5: The buzzers on the old microwave were so loud, they could wake up the whole house.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that buzzes
meanings.sent1: The bee was a tiny buzzer flying around the flowers.
meanings.sent2: The mosquito was a persistent buzzer in the room, bothering everyone.
meanings.sent3: The little buzzer of a fly kept landing on my food, making me shoo it away.
meanings.sent4: The buzzer of a hummingbird was a delightful sound in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The buzzer of the bee was a gentle hum in the peaceful meadow.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a telephone
meanings.sent1: She picked up the buzzer to call her friend and chat for hours.
meanings.sent2: The old rotary buzzer on the desk rang loudly, startling her.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the buzzer was his best friend, always ready to connect him with others.
meanings.sent4: The buzzer on the wall was like a lifeline, allowing her to reach out to loved ones.
meanings.sent5: The buzzer in her hand was her link to the outside world, bringing news and conversations.

meanings.definition: A slang term for an alarm or warning signal
meanings.sent1: The buzzer on the smoke detector alerted us to the fire in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The buzzer on the car's security system went off, scaring away the thief.
meanings.sent3: The buzzer on the weather alert system warned of an incoming storm.
meanings.sent4: The buzzer on the countdown clock signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent5: The buzzer on the emergency exit door sounded, signaling the need to evacuate.
